author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

In addition to the thi mentioned by the bot, I really think that the package should have some sort of explanation of what it is for and how to use it somewhere. The README is empty and there are no tests or documentation, so I don’t see why this should be on the general registry since it’s author is likely the only person likely to use it.

We are working actively on it at the moment. We will add documentation, examples and test problems. It will be open-source tool that will be widely used as our other SmartTensor tools. Please let me know what should I do to get it registered. Thank you!

[no_block]
Well, then let’s wait till there’s at least some minimal documentation before moving forward with registering this.

I just updated the Readme file

Please review

[no_block]

[noblock]

not sure why ipopt fails here.

please merge

@MasonProtter 

please merge. thank you. there are several packages that depend on this commit. these packages needs to be pushed soon as well. thank you!

I don’t have merge permissions, but the new README and such looks good to me! 

Maybe @DilumAluthge can help out?
@DilumAluthge can please merge?! Highly appreciated! We have several packages waiting and depending on SmartML. Thank you!

The following two still need to be fixed:

> * Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name
> 
> * No licenses detected in the package's top-level folder. An OSI-approved license is required.

---

For the `import` issue, we can manually merge even if the package is not `import`able.
